header: ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 29 of 2019 (Sagar Sharad Bhise Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000217­2019

background.text: 1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by accused in C.R.No. 44 of 2019 registered at Satara City Police Station.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure

arguments.text: 2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 14.01.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section 353, 323 of Indian Penal Code. Accused is at present in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, there is no substantial allegations, contents of FIR does not attract ingredients of Section 353 of I.P.C., there is no satisfactory explanation for delay in filing of FIR, prosecution story itself is suspicious, he is permanent resident on the address mentioned, he undertakes not to abscond, not to tamper with the prosecution evidence and to abide by the conditions imposed if any.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 14.01.2019.
The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section 353, 323 of Indian Penal Code.
Accused is at present in Magisterial Custody.

It is stated that, there is no substantial allegations, contents of FIR does not attract ingredients of Section 353 of I.P.C., there is no satisfactory explanation for delay in filing of FIR, prosecution story itself is suspicious, he is permanent resident on the address mentioned, he undertakes not to abscond, not to tamper with the prosecution evidence and to abide by the conditions imposed if any.

arguments.text: 3) In spite of sufficient opportunity, prosecution has not filed its say. Today, prosecution has filed second application seeking adjournment for filing say which came to be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: 3) In spite of sufficient opportunity, prosecution has not filed its say.
Today, prosecution has filed second application seeking adjournment for filing say which came to be rejected.

arguments.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused.

arguments.text: 5) The crime is registered in respect of offence punishable under Sec. 353, 323 of I.P.C. FIR is clearly disclosing that, the informant was not prevented by the accused from discharging his duty as a public servant. In such circumstance, accused may be released on bail. Accused is in custody since 15th January, 2019. Considering these facts, accused may be released on bail. Hence, following order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) The crime is registered in respect of offence punishable under Sec. 353, 323 of I.P.C. FIR is clearly disclosing that, the informant was not prevented by the accused from discharging his duty as a public servant.
In such circumstance, accused may be released on bail.
Accused is in custody since 15th January, 2019.
Considering these facts, accused may be released on bail.

order.text: O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 29 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused be released on bail on his furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) with one or two surety / sureties of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall not tamper with any evidence. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Accused shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required. d) Accused shall report the Investigation Officer before leaving Satara City. e) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. f) Compliance before lower Court.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :21st January, 2019. Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH.1 IN CRIMINAL BAIL APPLICATION No. 29 of 2019 (Sagar Sharad Bhise Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000217­2019 
---header-ends---
1) This the bail application under Sec. 439 of Code of Criminal Procedure is filed by accused in C.R.No. 44 of 2019 registered at Satara City Police Station. 
---background-ends---
2) Accused was arrested in above mentioned crime on 14.01.2019. The said crime is registered in respect of the offene punishable under Section 353, 323 of Indian Penal Code. Accused is at present in Magisterial Custody. It is stated that, there is no substantial allegations, contents of FIR does not attract ingredients of Section 353 of I.P.C., there is no satisfactory explanation for delay in filing of FIR, prosecution story itself is suspicious, he is permanent resident on the address mentioned, he undertakes not to abscond, not to tamper with the prosecution evidence and to abide by the conditions imposed if any. 
---argument-ends---
3) In spite of sufficient opportunity, prosecution has not filed its say. Today, prosecution has filed second application seeking adjournment for filing say which came to be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
4) Heard learned Advocate for the applicant­accused. 
---argument-ends---
5) The crime is registered in respect of offence punishable under Sec. 353, 323 of I.P.C. FIR is clearly disclosing that, the informant was not prevented by the accused from discharging his duty as a public servant. In such circumstance, accused may be released on bail. Accused is in custody since 15th January, 2019. Considering these facts, accused may be released on bail. Hence, following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 29 of 2019, is allowed. 2) Applicant­accused be released on bail on his furnishing P.R.Bond of Rs.15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen Thousand) with one or two surety / sureties of like amount with following conditions. a) Accused shall not tamper with any evidence. b) Accused shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade him from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Accused shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required. d) Accused shall report the Investigation Officer before leaving Satara City. e) Any default of above conditions shall render the bail to be cancelled automatically. f) Compliance before lower Court. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date :21st January, 2019. Satara
